    Registers a new middleware.

    Type Definitions

    ChopOptions
    util/constants.js, line 1

    Properties:
    Name Type Attributes Default Description
    prefix string

    The prefix used for commands.
    root string <optional>
    		 null

    Path to the directory Chop will look for commands, tasks, etc...
    If not set, Chop will use the directory where the client was instantiated.
    dmHelp Boolean <optional>
    		 true

    Should the help command send the command list through DMs?
    owners Array.<string>

    Super Users.
    showNotFoundMessage Boolean <optional>
    		 false

    Sends a command not found message if the prefix is used with an unknown command
    dmCommands string <optional>
    		 'ignore'

    How to handle commands in direct messages. Can be one of ignore, allow, error.
    If it's set to ignore all commands in DMs will be ignored. If it's set to allow commands
    with 'dm' in their runIn property will be allowed. If it's set to error a "Cannot execute
    commands in DMs" message will be sent.
    allowBots boolean <optional>
    		 false

    Can other bots use commands?
    findBestMatch Boolean <optional>
    		 false

    If a command cannot be found try to look for a similar named command.
    defaultCooldown number <optional>
    		 3

    The default cooldown for commands in seconds.
    typescript Boolean <optional>
    		 false

    Set this to true if your project is using typescript. This is for the file loader.
    botPermissions Object

    TBD
    messages Object

    The default messages.
    message.commandNotFound string

    The message to send when a command is not found.
    Since:
    • v0.0.1

    structures/Command.js, line 35

    Parameters:

    args Array.<string>

    call CommandCall
